Author: brettski74
Content: I think we need some way of gauging membership or engagement. I think we should have some kind of democratic process for running things and that everyone who's a member on the server should get a vote in major changes - maybe that's just who the mods and admins are or maybe that could also include major policy stuff if that makes sense. To do that, I think we need some measure of membership, though. I would want to avoid the possibility that we could get brigaded and have someone effectively take over the server by having a mass of new users who've never been here all suddenly vote in the new team. Maybe it's as simple as anyone who's been a member for 3 months or more gets a vote, or maybe there's something more around how many posts or replies or something. I'm not sure what possibilities we have.

Author: brettski74
Content: Channels - I think we should clarify what we think the different channels should contain and then come up with the name from there. Assembly and Flashing sounds like a help/questions type channel. The hardware and software development ones don't - primarily because of the word development. Not sure if that's what was intended.

Author: brettski74
Content: I think we probably need a place with information for newcomers - maybe that's a channel that is readable by everyone but only mods/admins can post there?

Author: brettski74
Content: We also need a better FAQ section. Maybe that's also something that could be a readable by everyone channel but only mods/admins post there.

Author: brettski74
Content:
The types of posts that come up could be broken down into three main categories I think.

Questions/requests for help

Author: brettski74
Content: Experimental results

Author: brettski74
Content: New design ideas and implementations.

Author: brettski74
Content: I'm thinking that may be a better way to break things down at the moment. We could potentially break questions down by hardware/software/assembly/programming,  Maybe that would help or maybe it would be overkill. My gut feeling is that there aren't a lot of different questions, but mostly a small number of questions that get asked repeatedly and I'm hoping that a better newcomers and FAQ section would help address most of those before people ask them.

Author: brettski74
Content: So maybe we have a group of channels for help/questions and then have one channel for hardware, software, programming and assembly.

Author: brettski74
Content: Maybe we have a group of general discussion channels with one each for different designs? Maybe that's just the AfterEarthLtd and Spatz designs at this time. Maybe my modular design, although I'm not sure if I meet my own criteria for considering it a design worthy of it's own channel at this point, so maybe that's just a dream for the future at the moment.

Author: brettski74
Content: I talked to discord a while ago. Yes - there are policies in place, but they won't transfer ownership to just anyone. It has to be a mod or an admin and aside from Chris who is the owner, there's only one mod - @ùìñùìæùì™ùìªùì≠ùì≤ùì™ùì∑ When I spoke to them, there were three things needed. >100 members. Owner absent for >30 days. A screenshot of a screen that's only accessible to mods and admins. That third one was where the request fell down since at the time, I didn't know that anyone but Chris has any elevated privileges. Later on I noticed Guardian was a mod and we spoke about options a bit, but from his comment above, it sounds like maybe the level of privileges he has aren't enough to meet Discord's transfer policies either.

Author: brettski74
Content: My current thoughts are that it's not much point creating a new discord or anything similar unless there's also something to drive traffic there. There are other forks and independent designs that have been more recently maintained, but I don't think any of them are getting too much traffic. My plan was to start making content and maybe try to get attention of some bigger electronics creators on YouTube to help generate some traffic, then move.

Author: electron271
Content: alrighty

Author: brettski74
Content: Someone did suggest having some pinned comments here to direct people to a new discord, but that feels kinda wrong. That feels more like stealing someone's legacy or something. I mean, Chris may not have been around for quite a while, but it was his design that captured sufficient attention to get us here. An ownership transfer can always be reversed if Chris returns, but I think if we're going to direct traffic toward a competing discord server, we should really do the work to earn that traffic because that's a much less reversible thing.

Author: brettski74
Content: I should slightly correct above... my fork has gotten some traffic, and I think some others have, too, but as far as I can tell, that's pretty much all from here, so I still feel like it's riding on Chris's coat-tails, so it's not really independent from Chris's work.

Author: darkbeer42
Content: @brettski74 I've been involved in opensource for quite a while -- decades and I will say this scenario happens pretty often.  Someone will create a project that a lot of people latch on to and then.. vapourise.. Starting a new discord and a new project and having a little historical document is just fine.  I really want to see this project take off I've made similar here at home but having it be an open project would be amazing.

Author: darkbeer42
Content: It's even worse to just let it sit around after all this time with no real direction, life happens in 5 years it'll be your work everything has to start from somewhere I really wouldn't worry about it.
